title: Turnpike traffic stop leads to crack cocaine bust 7 hours ago
content: A traffic stop on the Maine Turnpike in South Portland Friday night led to two arrests after more than 200 grams of crack cocaine was found. (Maine State Police)      SOUTH PORTLAND (WGME) -- Two people face drug charges after a Friday night traffic stop on the Maine Turnpike in South Portland led to the discovery of more than 200 grams of crack cocaine.    The midnight stop in South Portland eventually led state police to bring in a drug sniffing K-9, and a search of the vehicle found 263 grams of crack cocaine.    Police arrested Gregory Martin, of Augusta and Bronx, NY and Holly York of Rockland on aggravated trafficking charges.    Martin was also charged with being a fugitive from justice on a 2013 warrant out of New York for a parole violation.    Martin and York are being held at the Cumberland County Jail on $25,000 bail each.
